channel.title: Web701 on Ponte Posterum
channel.description: Recent content in Web701 on Ponte Posterum

item.title: Web701 1
item.description: Web Development 701 ~ Day 2 Today in web701 we covered the frameworks and softwares that are going to be used for the assessment. The frameworks are laravel (an open-source PHP web framework) and meteor (an open-source NodeJS web framework). The softwares are XAMPP (an open-source web server) and composer (a dependancy manager for PHP). I am going to be installing these on a ubuntu virtual machine, so the first thing I need to do is install virtualbox on my manjaro partition.

item.title: Web701 0
item.description: Web Development 701 Web development is a required class for my major (software development) in the bachelor of IT. The 701 class is based around CMS (content management systems) frameworks, similar to websites like wordpress or wix. However, in this class we have to install and deploy a CMS framework. A CMS is essentially a platform which allows a user to change the website without touching any code, usually the form of drag and drops.
